enabled.description: Enable audit logging for authorization decisions.

rules_path.description: Path to YAML rules file for builtin engine.

l2.description: L2 (distributed) cache for shared caching across instances.

jwt.description: TTL for validated JWT token cache.

enabled.description: Enable this health check.

critical.description: If true, failure marks service as unhealthy.

enabled.description: Enable circuit breaker for external service calls.

default.description: Default circuit breaker settings applied to all external calls.

services.description: Per-service circuit breaker settings. Key is service name (e.g. 'opa', 'keycloak').

max_requests.description: Maximum requests allowed in half-open state before deciding to close or open.

interval.description: Cyclic period for clearing failure counts when circuit is closed.

timeout.description: Duration of open state before switching to half-open.

failure_threshold.description: Number of consecutive failures before opening circuit.

success_threshold.description: Number of consecutive successes in half-open state to close circuit.

server.description: Server configuration for HTTP and gRPC endpoints.

proxy.description: Reverse proxy configuration. When enabled, authz-service forwards authorized requests to upstream services.

egress.description: Egress proxy configuration. When enabled, adds authentication to outbound requests to external services.

endpoints.description: Configurable API endpoint paths. Allows customizing URL paths for all service endpoints.

jwt.description: JWT token validation configuration. Defines trusted issuers, JWKS caching, and validation rules.

token_exchange.description: OAuth2 Token Exchange (RFC 8693) configuration for token delegation scenarios.

policy.description: Policy engine configuration. Supports builtin YAML rules, embedded OPA, or external OPA sidecar.

cache.description: Caching configuration. L1 (in-memory) for low latency, L2 (Redis) for distributed caching.

audit.description: Audit logging configuration. Records authorization decisions for compliance and debugging.

logging.description: Application logging configuration. Controls log level, format, and output.

health.description: Health check configuration for Kubernetes probes and monitoring.

resilience.description: Resilience patterns configuration. Includes rate limiting for incoming requests and circuit breaker for external calls.

sensitive_data.description: Sensitive data handling configuration. Controls masking of secrets, tokens, and PII in logs.

token_url.description: OAuth2 token endpoint URL. Used with oauth2_client_credentials and oauth2_refresh_token.

client_secret.description: OAuth2 client secret. Consider using environment variable: AUTHZ_EGRESS_TARGETS_<NAME>_AUTH_CLIENT_SECRET.

refresh_token.description: OAuth2 refresh token for oauth2_refresh_token type.

refresh_before_expiry.description: Refresh token this duration before expiry.

credentials_file.description: Path to GCP service account JSON key file. Used with gcp_service_account type.

role_arn.description: AWS IAM role ARN to assume. Used with aws_iam type.

header.description: Header name for API key. Example: 'X-API-Key'. Used with api_key type.

query_key.description: Query parameter name for API key. Alternative to header.

key.description: The API key value. Consider using environment variable.

password.description: Password for basic authentication. Consider using environment variable.

token.description: Static bearer token. Consider using environment variable. Used with bearer type.

enabled.description: Enable egress proxy mode for authenticated outbound requests.

targets.description: Named external systems configuration. Each target defines URL, authentication, and TLS settings.

routes.description: Routing rules mapping request paths to external targets.

defaults.description: Default settings applied to all targets unless overridden.

token_store.description: Token storage configuration for caching OAuth2 tokens.

timeout.description: Default request timeout for all targets.

retry.description: Default retry configuration for all targets.

password.description: Redis password. Consider using environment variable.

key_prefix.description: Prefix for token keys in Redis.

path_prefix.description: Match requests with path starting with this prefix. Example: '/external/partner-api'.

target.description: Name of the target from 'targets' map to route to.

strip_prefix.description: Remove this prefix from path before forwarding.

rewrite_prefix.description: Replace stripped prefix with this value.

methods.description: Restrict to these HTTP methods. Empty means all methods.

enabled.description: Enable TLS for connections to this target.

insecure_skip_verify.description: Skip server certificate verification. WARNING: Not recommended for production!

ca_cert.description: Path to CA certificate for server verification.

client_cert.description: Path to client certificate for mTLS authentication.

client_key.description: Path to client private key for mTLS authentication.

url.description: Base URL of the external service. Example: 'https://api.partner.com'.

timeout.description: Request timeout for this target. Overrides defaults.timeout.

auth.description: Authentication configuration for requests to this target.

tls.description: TLS configuration for secure connections to this target.

retry.description: Retry configuration for failed requests to this target.

egress.description: Egress proxy endpoint prefix. Requests to this prefix are forwarded to external targets.

include_headers.description: Request headers to include in audit logs.

mask_fields.description: Fields to mask in audit logs (for PII/sensitive data).

stdout.description: Stdout export configuration for local debugging.

enabled.description: Enable fallback policy when primary engine fails.

behavior.description: Default decision when fallback is used.

enabled.description: Enable gRPC server.

max_recv_msg_size.description: Maximum size of received messages in bytes.

max_send_msg_size.description: Maximum size of sent messages in bytes.

enabled.description: Enable HTTP server.

read_timeout.description: Maximum duration for reading entire request.

max_header_bytes.description: Maximum size of request headers in bytes.

name.description: Friendly name for this issuer (used in logs and metrics).

issuer_url.description: Expected 'iss' claim value. Must match exactly. Example: 'https://keycloak.example.com/realms/app'.

jwks_url.description: URL to fetch JWKS (public keys) for signature verification. Usually: {issuer_url}/.well-known/jwks.json or {issuer_url}/protocol/openid-connect/certs.

audience.description: Expected 'aud' claim values. At least one must match if specified.

algorithms.description: Allowed signing algorithms. Restricts which algorithms are accepted.

min_refresh_interval.description: Minimum interval between JWKS refreshes (rate limiting).

issuers.description: List of trusted JWT issuers. At least one issuer must be configured.

jwks_cache.description: JWKS (JSON Web Key Set) caching configuration.

enabled.description: Enable in-memory L1 cache.

max_size.description: Maximum number of entries in L1 cache.

enabled.description: Enable distributed L2 cache (Redis).

ttl.description: TTL settings for different cache entry types.

key_prefix.description: Prefix for all cache keys in Redis.

bundle_path.description: Path to OPA bundle file (tar.gz). Alternative to policy_dir.

data_dir.description: Directory containing JSON data files for OPA.

decision_path.description: Rego package path for authorization decision. Example: 'authz.allow' evaluates data.authz.allow.

hot_reload.description: Enable automatic policy reload on file changes.

enabled.description: Enable OTLP export to collectors like Jaeger, Tempo.
Enable partial masking (show first/last characters).

show_first.description: Number of first characters to show.

show_last.description: Number of last characters to show.

min_length.description: Minimum value length for partial masking. Shorter values are fully masked.

builtin.description: Builtin YAML rules engine configuration (when engine=builtin).

fallback.description: Fallback policy configuration when primary engine fails.

enabled.description: Enable reverse proxy mode. When true, authorized requests are forwarded to upstream services.

upstream.description: Default upstream server configuration. Used when no specific route matches.

upstreams.description: Named upstream servers for advanced routing. Reference by name in routes.

routes.description: Routing rules for selecting upstream based on request attributes (path, headers, methods).

headers.description: Header manipulation settings for proxied requests.

idle_conn_timeout.description: Idle connection timeout for HTTP connection pool.

retry.description: Retry configuration for failed upstream requests.

add.description: Headers to add to forwarded requests. Example: {'X-Forwarded-Proto': 'https'}.

remove.description: Headers to remove from forwarded requests. Example: ['Authorization', 'Cookie'].

forward.description: Headers to forward from original request (whitelist). Empty means forward all (except removed).

add_user_info.description: Add user information headers (ID, roles) to forwarded requests.

user_id_header.description: Header name for user ID (from JWT 'sub' claim).

enabled.description: Enable automatic retry for failed upstream requests.

initial_backoff.description: Initial backoff delay before first retry.

retry_on.description: HTTP status codes that trigger retry.

enabled.description: Enable rate limiting for incoming requests.

rate.description: Rate limit in format 'requests-period'. Periods: S (second), M (minute), H (hour), D (day). Example: '100-S' = 100 req/sec, '1000-M' = 1000 req/min.

redis.description: Redis configuration for distributed rate limiting (when store=redis).

trust_forwarded_for.description: Trust X-Forwarded-For header for client IP identification. Enable when behind proxy/load balancer.

exclude_paths.description: Paths to exclude from rate limiting. Supports glob patterns.

by_endpoint.description: Apply rate limits per endpoint instead of globally.

endpoint_rates.description: Per-endpoint rate limits. Key is path prefix, value is rate. Example: {'/v1/authorize': '1000-S', '/v1/token': '100-S'}.

enabled.description: Include rate limit headers in HTTP response (X-RateLimit-*).

limit_header.description: Header name for rate limit value.

password.description: Redis password. Consider using environment variable AUTHZ_RESILIENCE_RATE_LIMIT_REDIS_PASSWORD.

key_prefix.description: Prefix for rate limit keys in Redis.

addresses.description: Redis server addresses. Multiple for cluster mode.

password.description: Redis password. Consider using environment variable.

rate_limit.description: Rate limiting configuration for incoming HTTP requests. Protects service from overload.

circuit_breaker.description: Circuit breaker configuration for external service calls. Prevents cascade failures.

path_prefix.description: Match requests where path starts with this prefix. Example: '/api/v1'.

path_exact.description: Match requests with exactly this path. Example: '/health'.

path_regex.description: Match requests using regex pattern. Example: '^/api/v[0-9]+/.*$'.

methods.description: HTTP methods to match. Empty means all methods.

headers.description: Request headers to match (exact values). Example: {'X-Tenant': 'acme'}.

upstream.description: Name of the target upstream from 'upstreams' map.

rewrite_prefix.description: Replace matched prefix with this value. Used with strip_prefix.

strip_prefix.description: Remove this prefix from path before forwarding. Example: '/api' strips '/api/users' to '/users'.

enabled.description: Enable automatic masking of sensitive data in logs.

mask_value.description: Value to replace sensitive data with.

fields.description: Field names to mask in logs (case-insensitive). Applied to JSON keys and struct fields.

headers.description: HTTP header names to mask in logs (case-insensitive).

mask_jwt.description: Mask JWT token payload in logs (keeps header and signature indicator visible).

partial_mask.description: Partial masking configuration to show parts of sensitive values.

enabled.description: Enable audit log output to stdout.

format.description: Output format for stdout audit logs.

enabled.description: Enable OAuth2 Token Exchange (RFC 8693).

token_url.description: Token endpoint URL for exchange requests.

client_id.description: OAuth2 client ID for token exchange.

client_secret.description: OAuth2 client secret. Consider using environment variable.

url.description: Base URL of the upstream server. Example: 'http://backend:8080' or 'https://api.internal.local'.

tls.description: TLS configuration for secure upstream connections.

health_check.description: Health check configuration for upstream availability monitoring.

enabled.description: Enable periodic health checks for this upstream.

path.description: HTTP path for health check requests.

enabled.description: Enable TLS for upstream connections.

insecure_skip_verify.description: Skip server certificate verification. WARNING: Not recommended for production!

ca_cert.description: Path to CA certificate file for server verification. Required for self-signed certificates.

client_cert.description: Path to client certificate for mutual TLS (mTLS) authentication.

client_key.description: Path to client private key for mutual TLS (mTLS) authentication.

clock_skew.description: Allowed clock skew for exp/nbf/iat validation. Compensates for server time differences.

require_expiration.description: Require 'exp' claim in tokens. Recommended for security.

title: Authz Service Configuration
description:
Configuration schema for the authorization service.

Configuration can be provided via:
- YAML file (--config flag)
- Environment variables (AUTHZ_ prefix)

Environment variable naming: AUTHZ_<SECTION>_<KEY>
Example: AUTHZ_SERVER_HTTP_ADDR=:8080
